alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 03 at 3:34AM EDT until November 05 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A strong southward flowing longshore current in the surf zone today. Building, choppy surf expected Friday with breaking waves up to 5 feet developing. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Saint Lucie, Coastal Martin, Mainland Northern Brevard, Northern Brevard Barrier Islands, Mainland Southern Brevard and Southern Brevard Barrier Islands Counties. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Rough surf can knock you off your feet and make you even more susceptible to being caught in either a rip current or a longshore current. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will also be a Moderate Risk of Dangerous Rip Currents in the surf zone today and Friday. Never try to swim directly against either a longshore current or a rip current.
info.instruction: If you decide to enter the ocean today, do so only within sight of a lifeguard. Never enter the ocean along. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Entering the ocean on Friday is strongly discouraged due to the increasingly hazardous surf conditions.
